description: DISARM is a framework designed for describing and understanding disinformation incidents.
name: Countermeasures

values.description: Include a paid-for privacy option, e.g. pay Facebook for an option of them not collecting your personal information. There are examples of this not working, e.g. most people don’t use proton mail etc.
values.value: Charge for social media

values.description: Share fact-checking resources - tips, responses, countermessages, across respose groups.
values.value: Create shared fact-checking database

values.description: Find online influencers. Provide training in the mechanisms of disinformation, how to spot campaigns, and/or how to contribute to responses by countermessaging, boosting information sites etc.
values.value: Educate high profile influencers on best practices

values.description: Implement stronger privacy standards, to reduce the ability to microtarget community members.
values.value: Enhanced privacy regulation for social media

values.description: Create and use games to show people the mechanics of disinformation, and how to counter them.
values.value: Media literacy. Games to identify fake news

values.description: Empower existing regulators to govern social media. Also covers Destroy. Includes: Include the role of social media in the regulatory framework for media. The U.S. approach will need to be carefully crafted to protect First Amendment principles, create needed transparency, ensure liability, and impose costs for noncompliance. Includes Create policy that makes social media police disinformation. Includes: Use fraud legislation to clean up social media
values.value: Platform regulation

values.description: This is "strategic innoculation", raising the standards of what people expect in terms of evidence when consuming news. Example: journalistic ethics, or journalistic licencing body. Include full transcripts, link source, add items.
values.value: Rating framework for news

values.description: Update fact-checking databases and resources in real time. Especially import for time-limited events like natural disasters.
values.value: Real-time updates to fact-checking database

values.description: Alter and/or block the publication/dissemination of information controlled by disinformation creators. Not recommended.
values.value: Censorship

values.description: For example, use a media campaign to promote in-group to out-group in person communication / activities . Technique could be in terms of forcing a reality-check by talking to people instead of reading about bogeymen.
values.value: Repair broken social connections

values.description: includes Promote constructive communication by shaming division-enablers, and Promote playbooks to call out division-enablers
values.value: Reduce effect of division-enablers

values.description: Encourage offline communication
values.value: Encourage in-person communication

values.description: Used to counter ability based and fear based attacks
values.value: Innoculate. Positive campaign to promote feeling of safety

values.description: Includes promoting constructive narratives i.e. not polarising (e.g. pro-life, pro-choice, pro-USA). Includes promoting identity neutral narratives.
values.value: Promote healthy narratives

values.description: Messages about e.g. peace, freedom. And make it sexy. Includes Deploy Information and Narrative-Building in Service of Statecraft: Promote a narrative of transparency, truthfulness, liberal values, and democracy. Implement a compelling narrative via effective mechanisms of communication. Continually reassess messages, mechanisms, and audiences over time. Counteract efforts to manipulate media, undermine free markets, and suppress political freedoms via public diplomacy
values.value: Shore up democracy based messages

values.description: This is passive. Includes promoting civility as an identity that people will defend.
values.value: Create culture of civility

values.description: Blockchain audit log and validation with collaborative decryption to post comments. Use blockchain technology to require collaborative validation before posts or comments are submitted. This could be used to adjust upvote weight via a trust factor of people and organisations you trust, or other criteria.
values.value: Make information provenance available

values.description: Create websites in disinformation voids - spaces where people are looking for known disinformation.
values.value: Create fake website to issue counter narrative and counter narrative through physical merchandise
Develop a compelling counter narrative (truth based)

values.description: Create competing narratives. Included "Facilitate State Propaganda" as diluting the narrative could have an effect on the pro-state narrative used by volunteers, or lower their involvement.
values.value: Dilute the core narrative - create multiple permutations, target / amplify

values.description: Link to platform
values.value: Hijack content and link to truth- based info

values.description: Counters fake account
values.value: Create more friction at account creation

values.description: All of these would be highly affected by infiltration or false-claims of infiltration.
values.value: Infiltrate the in-group to discredit leaders (divide)

values.description: counters fake experts
values.value: third party verification for people

values.description: Focus on and boost truths in misinformation narratives, removing misinformation from them.
values.value: Address truth contained in narratives

values.description: Platforms can introduce friction to slow down activities, force a small delay between posts, or replies to posts.
values.value: Keep people from posting to social media immediately

values.description: Reduce the credibility of extremist groups posting misinformation.
values.value: Marginalise and discredit extremist groups

values.description: Flood disinformation spaces with obviously fake content, to dilute core misinformation narratives in them.
values.value: Honeypot with coordinated inauthentics

values.description: Think about the different levels: individual vs state-sponsored account. Includes “call them out” and “name and shame”. Identify social media accounts as sources of propaganda—“calling them out”— might be helpful to prevent the spread of their message to audiences that otherwise would consider them factual. Identify, monitor, and, if necessary, target externally-based nonattributed social media accounts. Impact of and Dealing with Trolls - "Chatham House has observed that trolls also sometimes function as decoys, as a way of “keeping the infantry busy” that “aims to wear down the other side” (Lough et al., 2014). Another type of troll involves “false accounts posing as authoritative information sources on social media”.
values.value: Name and Shame Influencers

values.description: Includes anti-elicitation training, phishing prevention education.
values.value: Counter social engineering training

values.description: Detect and degrade
values.value: Infiltrate platforms

values.description: remove or remove access to (e.g. stop the ability to update) old social media accounts, to reduce the pool of accounts available for takeover, botnets etc.
values.value: Delete old accounts / Remove unused social media accounts

values.description: Encourage people to leave spcial media. We don't expect this to work
values.value: Encourage people to leave social media

values.description: counters crowdfunding. Includes ‘Expose online funding as fake”.
values.value: Report crowdfunder as violator

values.description: third-party verification of projects posting funding campaigns before those campaigns can be posted.
values.value: Verification of project before posting fund requests

values.description: Take legal action against for-profit "factories" creating misinformation.
values.value: Legal action against for-profit engagement factories

values.description: Open-source libraries could be created that aid in some way for each technique. Even for Strategic Planning, some open-source frameworks such as DISARM can be created to counter the adversarial efforts.
values.value: Free open library sources worldwide

values.description: Includes “ban political micro targeting” and “ban political ads”
values.value: Reduce political targeting

values.description: Flood a disinformation-related hashtag with other content.
values.value: Co-opt a hashtag and drown it out (hijack it back)

values.description: Reduce the credibility of groups behind misinformation-linked funding campaigns.
values.value: Denigrate the recipient/ project (of online funding)

values.description: Resources = accounts, channels etc. Block access to platform. DDOS an attacker. TA02*: DDOS at the critical time, to deny an adversary's time-bound objective. T0008: A quick response to a proto-viral story will affect it's ability to spread and raise questions about their legitimacy. Hashtag: Against the platform, by drowning the hashtag. T0046 - Search Engine Optimisation: Sub-optimal website performance affect its search engine rank, which I interpret as "blocking access to a platform".
values.value: Block access to disinformation resources

values.description: Block websites, accounts, groups etc connected to misinformation and other information pollution.
values.value: Block source of pollution

values.description: Check special-interest groups (e.g. medical, knitting) for unrelated and misinformation-linked content, and remove it.
values.value: Remove non-relevant content from special interest groups - not recommended

values.description: Use training to build the resilience of at-risk populations. Educate on how to handle info pollution. Push out targeted education on why it's pollution. Build cultural resistance to false content, e.g. cultural resistance to bullshit. Influence literacy training, to inoculate against “cult” recruiting. Media literacy training: leverage librarians / library for media literacy training. Inoculate at language. Strategic planning included as inoculating population has strategic value. Concepts of media literacy to a mass audience that authorities launch a public information campaign that teaches the programme will take time to develop and establish impact, recommends curriculum-based training. Covers detect, deny, and degrade.
values.value: Inoculate populations through media literacy training
Identify and delete or rate limit identical content

values.description: normalise the language around disinformation and misinformation; give people the words for artefact and effect types.
values.value: normalise language

values.description: Make political discussion channels text-only.
values.value: Prohibit images in political discourse channels

values.description: Develop networks of communities and influencers around counter-misinformation. Match them to misinformation creators
values.value: Active defence: run TA15 "develop people” - not recommended

values.description: Includes “change image search algorithms for hate groups and extremists” and “Change search algorithms for hate and extremist queries to show content sympathetic to opposite side”
values.value: Change Search Algorithms for Disinformation Content

values.description: Create counternarratives, or narratives that compete in the same spaces as misinformation narratives. Could also be degrade
values.value: Create competing narrative

values.description: Discredit by pointing out the "noise" and informing public that "flooding" is a technique of disinformation campaigns; point out intended objective of "noise"
values.value: Highlight flooding and noise, and explain motivations

values.description: Also inoculation.
values.value: Ground truthing as automated response to pollution

values.description: Includes “poison pill recasting of message” and “steal their truths”. Many techniques involve promotion which could be manipulated. For example, online fundings or rallies could be advertised, through compromised or fake channels, as being associated with "far-up/down/left/right" actors. "Long Game" narratives could be subjected in a similar way with negative connotations. Can also replay technique T0003.
values.value: Modify disinformation narratives, and rebroadcast them

values.description: Rate-limit disinformation content. Reduces its effects, whilst not running afoul of censorship concerns. Online archives of content (archives of websites, social media profiles, media, copies of published advertisements; or archives of comments attributed to bad actors, as well as anonymized metadata about users who interacted with them and analysis of the effect) is useful for intelligence analysis and public transparency, but will need similar muting or tagging/ shaming as associated with bad actors.
values.value: Mute content

values.description: Example: Interject addictive links or contents into discussions of disinformation materials and measure a "conversion rate" of users who engage with your content and away from the social media channel's "information bubble" around the disinformation item. Use bots to amplify and upvote the addictive content.
values.value: Distract from noise with addictive content
Make more noise than the disinformation

values.description: Create honeypots for misinformation creators to engage with, and reduce the resources they have available for misinformation campaigns.
values.value: Fake engagement system

values.description: Set honeypots, e.g. communities, in networks likely to be used for disinformation.
values.value: Honeypot social community

values.description: Includes "Establish a truth teller reputation score for influencers” and “Reputation scores for social media users”. Influencers are individuals or accounts with many followers.
values.value: Establish a truth teller reputation score for influencers

values.description: Establish tailored code of conduct for individuals with many followers. Can be platform code of conduct; can also be community code.
values.value: Influencer code of conduct

values.description: Accountability move: make sure research is published with its funding sources.
values.value: Force full disclosure on corporate sponsor of research

values.description: Increase credibility, visibility, and reach of positive influencers in the information space.
values.value: Strengthen institutions that are always truth tellers

values.description: Reduce poll flooding by online taking comments or poll entries from verified accounts.
values.value: Require use of verified identities to contribute to poll or comment

values.description: remove blue checkmarks etc from known misinformation accounts.
values.value: Revocation of allowlisted or "verified" status

values.description: Improve content veerification methods available to groups, individuals etc.
values.value: Strengthen verification methods

values.description: Post large volumes of unrelated content on known misinformation hashtags
values.value: Hashtag jacking

values.description: Create participant friction. Includes Make repeat voting hard, and throttle number of forwards.
values.value: Create friction by rate-limiting engagement

values.description: This is reactive, not active measure (honeypots are active). It's a platform controlled measure.
values.value: Create a bot that engages / distract trolls

values.description: Shift influence and algorithms by posting more adverts into spaces than misinformation creators.
values.value: Buy more advertising than misinformation creators

values.description: Create emotive centrist content that gets more clicks
values.value: Click-bait centrist content

values.description: includes social media content take-downs, e.g. facebook or Twitter content take-downs
values.value: Content moderation

values.description: Reduce emotional responses to misinformation through calming messages, etc.
values.value: Dampen Emotional Reaction
Reduce polarisation by connecting and presenting sympathetic renditions of opposite views

values.description: Challenge misinformation creators to prove they're not an information operation.
values.value: "Prove they are not an op!"

values.description: Debunk fake experts, their credentials, and potentially also their audience quality
values.value: Debunk and defuse a fake expert / credentials.

values.description: Stop passing on misinformation
values.value: Don't engage with payloads

values.description: Debunk misinformation creators and posters.
values.value: Expose actor and intentions

values.description: Build and post information about groups etc's involvement in misinformation incidents.
values.value: Provide proof of involvement

values.description: Label promote counter to disinformation
values.value: Downgrade / de-amplify so message is seen by fewer people

values.description: Add countermessage text to iamges used in misinformation incidents.
values.value: Repurpose images with new text

values.description: debunk misinformation content. Provide link to facts.
values.value: Engage payload and debunk.

values.description: Redesign platforms and algorithms to reduce the effectiveness of disinformation
values.value: Open dialogue about design of platforms to produce different outcomes

values.description: Make algorithms in platforms explainable, and visible to people using those platforms.
values.value: Tool transparency and literacy for channels people follow.

values.description: reduce the visibility of known botnets online.
values.value: Remove or rate limit botnets

values.description: Don't engage with individuals relaying misinformation.
values.value: Don't feed the trolls

values.description: Produce material in advance of misinformation incidents, by anticipating the narratives used in them, and debunking them.
values.value: Prebunking

values.description: Create an alert system around disinformation and misinformation artefacts, narratives, and incidents
values.value: Social media amber alert

values.description: Repost or comment on misinformation artefacts, using ridicule or other content to reduce the likelihood of reposting.
values.value: Create friction by marking content with ridicule or other "decelerants"

values.description: fiscal sanctions; parallel to counter terrorism
values.value: Use banking to cut off access

values.description: Train local influencers in countering misinformation.
values.value: Mentorship: elders, youth, credit. Learn vicariously.

values.description: Take botnet servers offline by seizing them.
values.value: Seize and analyse botnet servers

values.description: Note: Similar to Deplatform People but less generic. Perhaps both should be left.
values.value: Deplatform Account*

values.description: Merged two rows here.
values.value: Deplatform message groups and/or message boards

values.description: Find communities likely to be targetted by misinformation campaigns, and send them countermessages or pointers to information sources.
values.value: Microtarget most likely targets then send them countermessages

values.description: File multiple lawsuits against known misinformation creators and posters, to distract them from disinformation creation.
values.value: Spam domestic actors with lawsuits

values.description: God knows what this is. Keeping temporarily in case we work it out.
values.value: Weaponise youtube content matrices

values.description: Applies to most of the content used by exposure techniques except "T0055 - Use hashtag”. Applies to analytics
values.value: "Bomb" link shorteners with lots of calls

values.description: Includes “this has been disproved: do you want to forward it”. Includes “"Hey this story is old" popup when messaging with old URL” - this assumes that this technique is based on visits to an URL shortener or a captured news site that can publish a message of our choice. Includes “mark clickbait visually”.
values.value: Platform adds warning label and decision point when sharing content

values.description: Use copyright infringement claims to remove videos etc.
values.value: (botnet) DMCA takedown requests to waste group time

values.description: Degrade the infrastructure. Could e.g. pay to not act for 30 days. Not recommended
values.value: Buy out troll farm employees / offer them jobs

values.description: Stop new community activity (likes, comments) on old social media posts.
values.value: Make amplification of social media posts expire (e.g. can't like/ retweet after n days)

values.description: If creators are using network analysis to determine how to attack networks, then adding random extra links to those networks might throw that analysis out enough to change attack outcomes. Unsure which DISARM techniques.
values.value: Add random links to network graphs

values.description: Includes Pollute the AB-testing data feeds: Polluting A/B testing requires knowledge of MOEs and MOPs. A/B testing must be caught early when there is relatively little data available so infiltration of TAs and understanding of how content is migrated from testing to larger audiences is fundamental.
values.value: Poison the monitoring & evaluation data

values.description: Align offensive cyber action with information operations and counter disinformation approaches, where appropriate.
values.value: Take pre-emptive action against actors' infrastructure

values.description: Train media to spot and respond to misinformation, and ask them not to post or transmit misinformation they've found.
values.value: Ask media not to report false information

values.description: Ban misinformation creators and posters from funding sites
values.value: Ban incident actors from funding sites

values.description: Civil engagement activities conducted on the part of EFP forces. NATO should likewise provide support and training, where needed, to local public affairs and other communication personnel. Local government and military public affairs personnel can play their part in creating and disseminating entertaining and sharable content that supports the EFP mission.
values.value: Better tell your country or organisation story

values.description: e.g. Create a campaign plan and toolkit for competition short of armed conflict (this used to be called “the grey zone”). The campaign plan should account for own vulnerabilities and strengths, and not over-rely on any one tool of statecraft or line of effort. It will identify and employ a broad spectrum of national power to deter, compete, and counter (where necessary) other countries’ approaches, and will include understanding of own capabilities, capabilities of disinformation creators, and international standards of conduct to compete in, shrink the size, and ultimately deter use of competition short of armed conflict.
values.value: Have a disinformation response plan

values.description: Identify key influencers (e.g. use network analysis), then reach out to identified users and offer support, through either training or resources.
values.value: find and train influencers

values.description: Advance coalitions across borders and sectors, spanning public and private, as well as foreign and domestic, divides. Improve mechanisms to collaborate, share information, and develop coordinated approaches with the private sector at home and allies and partners abroad.
values.value: Coalition Building with stakeholders and Third-Party Inducements

values.description: Kremlin’s narrative spin extends through constellations of “civil society” organisations, political parties, churches, and other actors. Moscow leverages think tanks, human rights groups, election observers, Eurasianist integration groups, and orthodox groups. A collection of Russian civil society organisations, such as the Federal Agency for the Commonwealth of Independent States Affairs, Compatriots Living Abroad, and International Humanitarian Cooperation, together receive at least US$100 million per year, in addition to government-organized nongovernmental organisations (NGOs), at least 150 of which are funded by Russian presidential grants totaling US$70 million per year.
values.value: Unravel/target the Potemkin villages

values.description: protect the interests of this population and, more importantly, influence the population to support pro-Russia causes and effectively influence the politics of its neighbours
values.value: compatriot policy

values.description: e.g. for leaked legal documents, use court motions to limit future discovery actions
values.value: Ensure integrity of official documents

values.description: international donors will donate to a basket fund that will pay a committee of local experts who will, in turn, manage and distribute the money to Russian-language producers and broadcasters that pitch various projects.
values.value: develop a creative content hub

values.description: Shift from reactive to proactive response, with priority on sharing relevant information with the public and mobilising private-sector engagement. Recent advances in data-driven technologies have elevated information as a source of power to influence the political and economic environment, to foster economic growth, to enable a decision-making advantage over competitors, and to communicate securely and quickly.
values.value: elevate information as a critical domain of statecraft

values.description: Removing accounts, pages, groups, e.g. facebook page removal
values.value: social media source removal

values.description: Free and fair press: create bipartisan, patriotic commitment to press freedom. Note difference between news and editorialising. Build alternative news sources: create alternative local-language news sources to counter local-language propaganda outlets. Delegitimize the 24 hour news cycle. includes Provide an alternative to disinformation content by expanding and improving local content: Develop content that can displace geopolitically-motivated narratives in the entire media environment, both new and old media alike.
values.value: Create a healthier news environment

values.description: Coordinated disinformation challenges are increasingly multidisciplinary, there are few organisations within the national security structures that are equipped with the broad-spectrum capability to effectively counter large-scale conflict short of war tactics in real-time. Institutional hurdles currently impede diverse subject matter experts, hailing from outside of the traditional national security and foreign policy disciplines (e.g., physical science, engineering, media, legal, and economics fields), from contributing to the direct development of national security countermeasures to emerging conflict short of war threat vectors. A Cognitive Security Action Group (CSAG), akin to the Counterterrorism Security Group (CSG), could drive interagency alignment across equivalents of DHS, DoS, DoD, Intelligence Community, and other implementing agencies, in areas including strategic narrative, and the nexus of cyber and information operations.
values.value: Improve Coordination amongst stakeholders: public and private

values.description: 1) Pollute the data voids with wholesome content (Kittens! Babyshark!). 2) fill data voids with relevant information, e.g. increase Russian-language programming in areas subject to Russian disinformation.
values.value: Fill information voids with non-disinformation content

values.description: Detect redirction or malware, then quarantine or delete.
values.value: Redirection / malware detection/ remediation

values.description: highlight misinformation activities and actors in media
values.value: Media exposure

values.description: Includes SEO influence. Includes promotion of a “higher standard of journalism”: journalism training “would be helpful, especially for the online community. Includes Strengthen local media: Improve effectiveness of local media outlets.
values.value: Newsroom/Journalist training to counter influence moves

values.description: Use ongoing analysis/monitoring of "flagged" profiles. Confirm whether platforms are actively removing flagged accounts, and raise pressure via e.g. government organisations to encourage removal
values.value: Ensure that platforms are taking down flagged accounts

values.description: Government open engagement with civil society as an independent check on government action and messaging. Government seeks to coordinate and synchronise narrative themes with allies and partners while calibrating action in cases where elements in these countries may have been co-opted by competitor nations. Includes “fight in the light”: Use leadership in the arts, entertainment, and media to highlight and build on fundamental tenets of democracy.
values.value: open engagement with civil society

values.description: Use Google AdWords to identify instances in which people search Google about particular fake-news stories or propaganda themes. Includes Monetize centrist SEO by subsidising the difference in greater clicks towards extremist content.
values.value: Redirect searches away from disinformation or extremist content

values.description: Standard reporting for false profiles (identity issues). Includes detecting hijacked accounts and reallocating them - if possible, back to original owners.
values.value: remove suspicious accounts

values.description: FIXIT: standardise language used for influencer/ respected figure.
values.value: Respected figure (influencer) disavows misinfo

values.description: Set honeytraps in content likely to be accessed for disinformation.
values.value: Set data 'honeytraps'

values.description: Remove access to official press events from known misinformation actors.
values.value: Stop offering press credentials to propaganda outlets

values.description: Increase civic resilience by partnering with business community to combat grey zone threats and ensuring adequate reporting and enforcement mechanisms.
values.value: strong dialogue between the federal government and private sector to encourage better reporting
Run a competing disinformation campaign - not recommended
Use humorous counter-narratives

values.description: Increase public service experience, and support wider civics and history education.
values.value: build public resilience by making civil society more vibrant

values.description: Prevent ad revenue going to disinformation domains
values.value: Use advertiser controls to stem flow of funds to bad actors

values.description: Steganography. Adding date, signatures etc to stop issue of photo relabelling etc.
values.value: Add metadata to content that’s out of the control of disinformation creators

values.description: Create a plan for misinformation and disinformation response, before it's needed. Include connections / contacts needed, expected counteremessages etc.
values.value: Develop a monitoring and intelligence plan

values.description: Include PACE plans - Primary, Alternate, Contingency, Emergency
values.value: Run a disinformation red team, and design mitigation factors

values.description: Simulate misinformation and disinformation campaigns, and responses to them, before campaigns happen.
values.value: Tabletop simulations

values.description: Improve trust in the misinformation responses from social media and other platforms. Examples include creating greater transparancy on their actions and algorithms.
values.value: Strengthen Trust in social media platforms
